Reviews.Title: “Visited again”
Reviews.Author: djw1955
Reviews.Content: Visited again for a mini break and really enjoyed the friendly atmosphere, cleaniness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “left hotel after I realized how bad it was”
Reviews.Author: etto
Reviews.Content: very run down and filthy. bars on windows (no escape in case of fire). only stay here if u are not too picky concerning where u lay your head at night. I left after about 20 min of being in my room when I realized I wouldn't be able to sleep if I stayed the night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: 45-nomad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Victoria train, coach and tube stations. The hotel is like the other small hotels on the street in terms of having small rooms, very small washrooms and lots of stairs to climb (depending on the floor you are on). For a short stay and the price, this hotel fits the bill. It has a free internet kiosk. The room I had (211) was clean, with a good mattress. The breakfast is so so (the serving staff were less than enthusiastic), other hotels on the street have better and if it isn't enough, the train station has plenty of other food options. It is about a 15 pound cab ride to paddington train station if you are going to the airport at early/late hours.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but not chic”
Reviews.Author: PeteandRuss
Reviews.Content: Hotel is extremely basic and not very clean. On our two night stay we asked to be moved to another room as our double matris was so old you could feel the springs coming through. You really get what you pay for. Spending a little bit more per night can get you a much better hotel

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place with good location”
Reviews.Author: kefer9
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really good,few minutes far from Victoria station. The bathroom was definitely too small,no space for my leg when using the toilet and the shower was just a tap almost on top of the toilet. The breakfast quality was not so good. In general I think it is a good hotel for the price they offer and I would recommend it for short stays or business trip in London.

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap or nice”
Reviews.Author: Vicki0503
Reviews.Content: I work for a charity and we try to book cheap places to stay. Â£80 however was, in my opinion, too much for this place. The guy at the desk was rude, the main entrance was being re-done and covered in wet plaster, the room was ok but not comfortable, the bathroom was tiny and like previously said everything got soaked when you used the shower. The description of the breakfast was 'continental' is a joke. The breakfast room was in the basement where a surly woman gave me 2 pieces of toast and some hot water to go with the jar of Nescafe on my table. The other option was some stale cereal. Needless to say I left after my 2 pieces of toast and went to Starbucks. I've told my work never to use this hotel ever again as I believe it's a total rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting , Joke of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeMpl
Reviews.Content: I am now reading the reviews, but wish i did before i booked a double room at the Carlton. How they can call this a hotel is a joke . I stayed with my partner for one night on 29th April ( the Royal wedding) i paid Â£74 and stayed in room 2008. One good comment i will make is the location , Belgrave Road is a very short walk from the coach and train station ,it has lots of hotels , But my friendly advice is stay clear of the Carlton. I should have gone with first instinct when the reception staff was not friendly. The room ...very small , bed very hard with one pillow per person that had seen better days . Linen was clean on first inspection , well one sheet and one blanket . What i thought was the cupboard turned out to be the shower / toilet . Small and cramped is not the word , a cross between a caravan toilet , aeroplane toilet and a kids wardrobe . I think the wardrobe would have been the cleaner option. I am surprised the fixtures worked, i think it was the limescale and dirt holding them together, shower runs hot and cold and floods the bathroom . Television picture was snowy , after you have cleaned the dust off the screen .The room was dirty , dusty with stains and burns on the carpet . The chair at the dressing table was similar to a childs highchair after they had finished dinner . Avoid the hotel telephone in the room at all costs , unless you have a bottle of bleach handy , combination of dirt and grease ( see photos) Breakfast ......08.00 - 09.00 . I felt sorry for the lady who serves breakfast , she was clearly unhappy or having a bad day , She puts the value bread in the toaster for you , whether you want it or not , Then presents you with caramelished toast , That while your eating stale cereal , so time you have finished the toast is cold , hard and caramelised . Dont forget to enjoy the view from the window and the decor ( bags of plaster ) and peeling plaster on walls . Check out ... Before we checked out we thought we would remove the bottom sheet from the bed ************Do not do this *********** The mattres is the horror or horrors, Stained with blood , soaked in urine and a manner of body fluids . If all this sounds appealing by all means book a room in the house or horrors I would rather stay in the subways or a park bench then the Carlton .

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: illiadis
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived from London. I've stayed in this hotel for two nights. we had a horrible experience because we were 4 people and they made a mistake with our booking and they wanted to give us a 3 bed room, when we were 4. and they wanted us to pay more... after having discussed with them and BOOKING (please don't use this web). Suddenly there was a 4 bed room for the price I've booked. About the rest... well... beds are horrible, bathroom too... breakfeast... it's the first time I prefer to stay outside than inside my hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Carlton: Bad&Bed”
Reviews.Author: koruma
Reviews.Content: small bedroom and bathroom for a couple. Opening & closing time breakfast too much reduced (8-9 am). staff very kind.Internet free. blanket and bedspread were very clean. Strenght point of Carlton hotel is located a good street, near to Victoria station and coach station, to Parliament House (Big Ben) and to Westminster. At a short distance to bus stop "24".

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: KoKoOreo
Reviews.Content: The Carlton Hotel is in an excellent area, with bus stop right outside the door and a short walk to Victoria Station. That is where it ends. We stayed for 4 nights, had 2 rooms for 4 nights and an additional room for 2 nights for our teen age son who joined us later. The rooms were small, cramped and cold. The bathroom was so small you couldn't shut the door while sitting. This is the first bathroom I have encountered where you could , shower, shave and brush your teeth without moving! The breakfast was terrible. From the dirty instant coffee jars to the crusted sugar bowls there was nothing appealing about it. We only ate there once in the four days. While the rooms were clean the beds were extremely uncomfortable. We expected economy accomodations however this hotel was a huge disappointment. Fortunately we spent very little time here as we were out sight seeing from early morning until after dark

Reviews.Title: “nice budget hotel, but room was FREEZING!”
Reviews.Author: simovalley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Carlton hotel for one night in October 2010. I had a single bedroom just a few steps away from the reception: the room was cute and clean, with a tiny bathroom and the breakfast (a simple one, with toasted bread, coffee and orange juice) was included in the price. Location is perfect too, as the hotel is located middle way between Victoria and Pimlico (about 10 mins walking from both stations) and #24 bus stop is very close to it too. Only drawback is that my room was very cold and I was freezing at night, don't know if the heating was broken or something had happened but I was too exhausted even to complain. Staff were very kind, apart from one of the women in the breakfast room which seemed very pissed off all the time. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definately leave this one alone”
Reviews.Author: flowercity
Reviews.Content: Because our usual hotel was full, we booked in here over the internet, were told it was 10 minutes from Victoria Coach station . yes by car, 25 minutes to walk - no good with luggage at 2.30am!! The receptionist was a joke, he promised to book us a taxi for 2.15 the following morning as we had discovered they told us wrong over how long it took to walk to V.Coach station. We went out to find a cash machine and on our return, were told the taxi would be Â£15, for a journey taking 10 minutes, because we had been travelling all day, my husband wanted to get away as quickly as possible, but the driver was obviously one of his friends, We should have insisted he used the meter.Although we had to pay for the inclusive breakfast, we had nothing, because our early departure meant the 'kitchen' was closed - even to the staff. The room was dismal to say the least, you couldn't turn round in the shower, which was squashed into a corner, with a very shallow tray, which meant if you used it, you would probably flood the bedroom, been done before, judging by the state of the bottom of the door. The sink was very old, cracked and dirty.The staircase was uneven and dirty, no help with carrying luggage and the whole building was dirty and cramped. I would rather sleep on the floor at the bus station than stay here again and we will be reporting the state of this dump to the management and hotel watchdog.

Reviews.Title: “A very poor experience: dirty, crampped and a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: MHSC
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked accommodation at this hotel (for both us and two of her family members visiting the UK for the first time), having read reviews of its "good levels of cleanliness". However, it was the complete opposite: the hotel is dirty and crampped. Upon arrival, the receptionist's manner was acceptable enough; but one could tell that she just wanted the money. We got to the room full of promise, however it was a massive letdown: the room was dingy; there were somebody else's clothes in the wardrobe; the bathroom was tiny and very dirty; the TV was not in full working order; there was no tea or coffee; and the mattress was as stiff as a plank of wood. The "Continental breakfast" was simply not up to scratch: two pieces of (burnt) toast; small jugs of milk and orange juice; and small bowls of cereal. The breakfast staff were quite rude. Moreover, the fact that breakfast is between only 8-9am - and that the breakfast room is tiny - means that you could be waiting ages for a free table. Considering that the room cost Â£74 per night, this was an absolute rip-off. I will not be returning, since there are far better options elsewhere. The only positive thing was that, being in Pimlico, it was quite accessible via the transport network. I am embarrassed that her family members had to stay in this dive, seeing as there are other hotels that are a million times better that cost less money. Whatever you do, avoid this hotel like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and crap service !!!”
Reviews.Author: nev56
Reviews.Content: So my partner booked this hotel for our trip away after booking the room and giving card details they sent her a guest secret number and reservation number. After a long trip from ireland my partner went to check in only to find that they didnt book them a room! After telling them we had a guest secret number and reservation number they still insisted we had no room. At 12:39 at night they told us they had no room at the hotel! this hotel is disgracefull! We was left very upset and with no where to sleep, once more they still had my partners card details! NO-ONE SHOULD STAY HERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “steer clear of this dump”
Reviews.Author: eidsvold
Reviews.Content: This place is a disgrace. The night receptionist is an idiot. I checked in here because someone on this website said it was good value for money!! On entering my cubicle, I found the waste bin full of rubbish. I'd already paid my money and it was too late to back out. The woman serving the paltry breakfast was sullen, could not speak english and was either bing badly treated by her employer or simply hated her job. There are many hotels along Belgrave Road and you don't have to look hard to find a vast improvement on this place for the similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hovel”
Reviews.Author: EpicureEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here- stay in a public toilet cubicle overnight and get the same experience but for free. Dirty, noisy, tiny rooms- yuk!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right. This is the worst hotel ever! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: HamishlovesSpike
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this as a surprise for me as it is close (10 mins walk) from the Apollo Victoria where we saw Wicked. On arrival we noticed a strange musty smell but as my boyfriend had prepaid we decided to stay. Plus the lady at reception was friendly enough. On entering out room 208 we were struck by the tiny size of the room. Barely enough room to squeeze around the one side of the small double bed. The windows were old and single glazed so we had the pleasure of drunken revellers and traffic all night long. Being pregnant at present my only concern was a comfy bed and a nice bathroom. Unfortunately the Carlton had neither. The bed was rock hard, with frayed pillowcases and not at all inviting after a day walking the streets. The bathroom was a glorified cupboard. It was in effect a tiny wetroom with a showerhead almost over the toilet. We hoped that the breakfast wouldn't be as bad as expected but it was worse. The breakfast room is only open from 8am to 9am and has around 6 tables to seat 4 people. It was crammed into a small room in the basement. We went down to eat at 8.15 and the room was full so we went back to our room for 10 mins. We went down again at 8.25, 8.35 and 8.45. At 8.45 we decided to stand in the hall to wait for a table. We finally sat down to eat at 8.50 but there was no food left! We waited for 10 mins but none arrived. On the whole this is a smelly, overpriced excuse for a hotel. Please book anywhere else but the Carlton B&B!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Uncomfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tfccjoyce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a horrible stay at this hotel! The room was very dirty, the "coffee maker" was caked with grime, the bed was extremely uncomfortable and the walls are so thin that you can hear EVERYTHING going on in the rest of the hotel, all hours of the night. The "Continental Breakfast" consisted of dry cereal, instant coffee and toast in a small room downstairs with about 5 or 6 tables (not nearly enough to accomodate all guests) that were not wiped clean from the other guests who ate there. We even missed breakfast one morning because there was not enough room for us to sit anywhere. Last but not least, the bathroom floor flooded with water whenever we took a shower because there was not adequate drainage nor a "lip" to contain the water .

Reviews.Title: “unbelievably awful”
Reviews.Author: NoFixedPlans
Reviews.Content: I read the TripAdvisor reviews of this hotel before booking and, having travelled extensively staying in hostels, dismissed the complaints as the typical whining of tourists expecting 5-star treatment for 2-star prices. I can put up with a bit of dirt and cramped quarters if it's central and cheap, and who spends that much time in their room anyway? Please read all these reviews and believe what is said about the negative aspects of this place because it is true, and more. Our room was on the top floor (room 220) and not only were the sheets stained and the mattress mildewed all down the side, but the carpets were filthy and frayed, there was long black hair in the bathroom, the toilet was leaking from the base and had "sunk" into a pool of vile-smelling liquid on the plastic floor. Sitting on it was precarious and an exercise in not getting one's feet wet from the leakage. When having a shower in the tiny 3x4 bathroom with a stained, smelly plastic shower curtain (impossible not to touch and have it stick to you when showering in that tiny space), water would run all over the floor, creating an overpowering urine stench from the obviously crusty stucco-like plastic floor and the pool of water/urine around the base of the toilet which would wash all over the bathroom floor when the shower was on. My daughter and I had to go out and buy flipflops just to make the bathroom experience tolerable. We requested another room (also because my elderly father was joining us mid-way through our stay and could not climb the 8 flights of stairs easily) and were treated fairly rudely by the night clerk. (Although the young woman on the desk during the day was quite polite and helpful.) When we did change rooms (to room 209) it was somewhat better, having high ceilings, a balcony and a clean(er) bathroom floor. It still had the basic cleanliness problems including other people's bandaids, razors and used tissue under the beds and cigarette butts and beer bottles on the balcony. We also had an over-anxious maid banging on our door at 10 am one day when we were trying to sleep in, insisting she clean the room. Don't bother with the breakfast - instant coffee, wonderbread toast and tang. Croissants, yogourt and tea were OK though. Spend a bit more and stay at the comfort inn next door (it's lovely but twice as much) or the easyhotel.com or the belgrave inn on the same block which are cheaper - there are lots of hotels in this area that are a bit more expensive but infinitely nicer. At the very least insist on seeing your room first, as our second room was much better than the first one. I may not have had the same reaction if we had been given that room first.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommending this bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RCMM
Reviews.Content: It was very expensive for its price because its amenities weren't good. We booked for five nights and I already indicated how many people we were, but they expected us not to have heavy luggage so they reserved our room on the top floor and there's no lift. There was no way to bring our luggage using the very narrow stairs so they had to give us this tiny, tiny room on the basement on our first night. They transferred us the following day to a room on the 2nd floor which was only a little bit bigger than the first room. The bed covers were dirty with hairs (a lot of hairs from the previous guests). On our last day my son shoved his toy cars under the bed so we had to move the bed to get them and surprise, surprise, the bed was very easy to move but was never moved to clean the floor. There was dust, tissue papers, a razor, plastic bag and a lot of other garbage that made me want to throw up. The bathroom was very small, it was hard to move around. The smoke alarm was set off about 3 times when we were there and we were terrified the first time but it was just false alarms. The breakfast was very ordinary, the breakfast room very small, either you go there very early to get a table or you go very late so everyone else is finished.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Jammyb_2000
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms. One was supposidly a double but my Mother said that "she couldn't swing a cat in there". I stayed in a twin room. The sheets were clean but we had one blanket on each bed and a bed spread which was heavily stained. The light switch was filthy and needed a good wipe down with some bleach. The shower head was encrusted with lime scale and mould but the rest of the bathroom was ok. Breakfast was a bit of an ordeal. The 'waitress' didn't speak any english and my mother thought she looked like she had just got out of bed. Her t-shirt had food stains all over it. Breakfast consisted of toast and butter along with jam if you were lucky. I didn't risk cereal. Every bowl, cup and plate was chipped. The glass jug containing the watered-down orange juice was also chipped. This hotel is ok as a 1 star but not 2. On the whole, I would suggest that you spend another Â£20 or Â£30 and stay somewhere a bit nicer. I think I would go so far to say that this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. From now on, 3 stars is the absolute minimum.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: The-Three-Tourists
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy hotel, but it is very practical. It is centrally located near Victoria Station. The price is right. Yes, the bathroom was tiny, but we found our room to be clean and comfortable. There is so much to see in London, that we wanted to spend as little time in the room as possible anyway. The breakfast was adequate. The receptionists were helpful and knowledgeable. We will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “not comming back”
Reviews.Author: halloen
Reviews.Content: the bad things: The smallest bathrooms I've ever seen. Not the cleanest and nicest hotel I've stayed at. Could be nice with a make-over, the showercurtains didn't look clean ect. Not much of a breakfast, and I didn't like the fact that you might have to sit at the same table as other families... The good things: not much noise from the streets on eighter side of the building the woman in the reseption was nice not far from tube/trains, pubs and shopping center But it wasn't expensive so I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Better then a Hostel”
Reviews.Author: nevets_83
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a place to stay for one night and found the rate at the Carlton to be extremnly favourable. The location was great with easy access to both the Tube and the bus, however we practically walked everywhere from the hotel. We did not take advantage of the free breakfast, however took advantage of the free internet offered in the lobbyish area. The staff was friendly and informative. The rooms were also clean where I was able to enjoy some BBC. Overall, was very pleased with my stay at the Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here because we arrived late at night and all other normal hotels nearby were booked. Fortunately, it was only for one night. I wasn't expecting much out of this place, but we were tired and had few options. The bathroom was disgraceful, so small I could barely stretch my arms out. The room was barely big enough for our luggage. No elevator either. Fortunately it was a cool night because there was no A/C, as is the case with many central London hotels. I would never, ever, stay here again. You can often judge a hotel by its lobby--this one had none. Try some of the better known hotels along Belgrave Road.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST hotel imaginable. We booked a "triple" for 95 Euros but when we arrived there were only 2 twin beds. We were told the hotel was booked and they refused to reduce our rate. The room was horrible.... TINY room with no walking space and no room for our luggage, peeling wallpaper, rock-hard beds, dirty ugly green carpet, tiny RV-style bathroom, cheap sheets and bedspread. Even with the window shut you couldn't sleep with all the street noise below. I'd heard how bad London hotels could be but I couldn't have imagined it being this bad and it is in a very seedy part of London. To think we paid close to $170 to stay in this pit! Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Carlton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was totally misrepresented in their pictures. The room had broken windows, no ventilation except the open window. The bathroom was nothing more than an Recreation Vehicle insert. No room to move much less take a decent shower. I suspect these were put in to elimate the door the hall bathroom. The bed was in very poor shape as was the pillows. It was so lumpy no one could sleep. The included breakfast was burnt toast, orange juice, a pot of boiling water to fix either instant tea or coffee, cereal and yogurt with a selection of jams & jellies. Not very appealing and everyone in the breakfast room was as surprised as we were. The only redeeming qualities - the bedsheets were clean and the bedspread and curtains matched!! Where were the rooms in the pictures???

HotelInfo.Name: Carlton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 90 Belgrave Road | Victoria, London SW1V 2BJ, England
